result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven J. Hoffmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Judge O'Melia with Amended Revocation & Order Warrant - Price Co. jail credit
revoked
quashing writ

10:17 a.m. Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf51 and 15cf128. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Sowinski - requests adjournment to determine defendant's eligibility for "Ticket to Work" program from SSI and release on Huber. Shawl statement potential guardianship. DIscussion concerning sentence recommendations. Sowinski/Shawl/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court sentence
Jail - 9 months each count concurrent to any other sentence. With Huber for all purposes - ticket to work program. May serve in Price County.
Jail credit - 257 days
Any unpaid financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment. 
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 10:41 a.m.
-includes revocation summary
for Court hearing from DOC

11:45 am Calling 15cf51, 15cf76, 15cf123, 15cf128 and 15fo457. Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss 15cf76 and 15cf123 - Granted. Bednar states Victim rights legislation complied with-no response from victim. In 15cf128, State moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor battery - violation of 940.19(1) and to dismiss, but read in Counts 2 and 3 - Granted. In 15cf51, State moves to amend Count 1 to Misdemeanor battery - violation of 940.19(1) and to dismiss but read in Count 2 - Granted.  State moves to dismiss 15FO457 provided defendant be required to pay restitution as a condition of probation  Granted. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Shawl/Defendant/Defendant's Grandfather/Court statement to sentencing.

Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 2 yrs.
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
DNA Sample
Courtesy collection of restitution in 15FO457 (per defendant $86.72 to Walmart)
Take prescription medicine in manner/dosages as prescribed.
Continue with counseling, medical appointments as recommended.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Jail credit - 127 days - open for 10 days for stipulation by counsel - if no contact within 10 days 127 days credit stands
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights given
Adj. 12:02 p.m.

9:09 a.m. Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf76, 15cf128, 15cf123 adn 15cf51. Shawl moves to withdraw NGI pleas - Granted. Bednar/Shawl statements to necessity of doctor's testimony. Bednar statement to global resolution of all cases. Bednar/Shawl statement to modify bond. State does not object to bond mofication. Court sets $10,000 sig bond with same conditions as prior bonds with one additional condition - Between hours of 9:00 p.m. and  6:00 a.m. must be at grandparent's residence.  If defendant not at residence by 9:05 p.m.- grandparents to call sheriff and report. No contact with victims, no contact with any children under age 18 unless supervised and only if children are family members. Adj. 9:15 a.m.
for Modification of Defendant's Bail
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
for Examination under 971.16 (Not guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)
Requested Amended Order for Examination from Denise in DA's office with corrected address for Dr. Brad Smith.
Order for Examination
for Examination under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)

02:58 pm - Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf51, 15cf123, 15cf6 and 15cf128.  Shawl states today's hearing was to determine who would complete the mental examination.  State files order for examination.  Court signs order.  Bail continued.  Adjourned 03:02 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:38 - 
Calling 15cf51,15cf76,15cf123,15cf128 and 15fo457
  Defendant waives preliminary hearings in all 4 cases. Waivers free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
In receipt of all 4 informations- waive readings- not guilty plea by means of  mental disease of defect on all 4 cases - Court will appoint  Dr Galli - Shawl statement - Bednar statement  - defendant to go to inpatient at Winnebago and have eval there- Bednar to provide name within 24 hours - and have order drafted 
Shawl further statement regarding competency - still objecting to findings - request additional compentency evaluation -= Court so orders and will allow both evals to be handled down there 

  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Bond continued
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 06-29-2015 03:30 pm
Character Reference

11:25 am - Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court, via video,  with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf123, 15cf128, 15cf51 and 15cf76.    In receipt of complaints, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  Shawl statement to motion to modify bond.  Bednar statement to motion to modify bond.  Defendant statement to bond.  Court denies  - Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 10:30 am.

09:08 am - Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court, via video,  with attorney Richard John Shawl.  Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf123 (MH), 15cf128 (AIA),  15cf76 and 15cf51 (STC).  Shawl states was not aware of most recent file, 5cf128 - Shawl requests adjournment and requests AIA on 15cf123 and 15cf128.  Schiek statement to the potential duplicity of charges in 15cf123 and 15cf128 - Schiek statement to charges in both cases and the apporpirateness of filing in each case.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 11:30 am.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18

01:30 pm - Defendant Steven J. Hoffmann in court, via video, in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint to be faxed to jail, right to counsel - Rick Shawl represents in underlying cases - Defendant directed to contact the PD's office.  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.
